page.title: 15Trueloves-a typical day
page.content: The ages of the residents range from 18 to 33 and bedrooms are shared. None of them is married, because it is not encouraged for the mentally handicapped. Breakfast is served at 9am and the residents move places at the table so that their memories do not lock onto one routine. After breakfast they usually go to work at the local adult training centre during the day. The evening meal is eaten at 6pm and then, in the evening, they can watch television or play games or there might be a social evening organised. Around the site the residents help to build up the smallholding, where they are trying to grow fruit and vegetables, and also help to look after their animals, such as horses and ducks. Some of the residents go back home for the weekends.
